page.title: 06Leicester's Mr Elvis
page.content: Mick Haywood's fascination with{Elvis {Presley}began in 1956. Everything about Elvis excited Mick. So Mick began to copy the way Elvis looked, and ever since has devoted all his spare time to Elvis's music and rock'n roll. Now Mick and his wife live at the{House of Elvis,}on Hawthorne Street with their daughter Lisa, named after Elvis's daughter. Over the years Mick has acquired a vast amount of Elvis memorabilia, including videos of every film and major concert in which Elvis has appeared. Since Elvis's death in 1977, Mick and his wife have converted their attic into a shrine to house their Elvis collection. Mick has taken part in radio and TV shows about Elvis, and his Elvis collection has been on public display. Their pet dog is named Princess Marie of Memphis in honour of Elvis's daughter.
